title: SELL3R
author: SELL3R
content: I saw someone suggest faucetcrypto website and I have signed up and realised the small tasks work but only reward you with very little coins. When I try to do the big offer tasks I can never seem to complete it and I get so many pop ups and site keeps redirecting. Also when I tried to withdraw I couldn’t as I needed 1500 coins first.Is this site legit or just a waste of time and a scam?Can anyone recommend a better website for earning free crypto that doesn’t have a catch to it and doesn’t have any withdrawing restrictions etc? Ps: I’m new to crypto and would like to own my very first crypto….

comments.author: Faisal2202
comments.body: Quote from: SELL3R on March 05, 2023, 07:52:18 AMsnipHey SELL3R, welcome abroad i can see its your first post here. I would love to give my insights. Faucets are micro earning platforms from where you can earn decent amount of money if you have great following. the more the followers are the more will be the earning your could make by making more referrals. At start i also stuck in many faucet website back in 2018. at that time i was not even know that there is this Bitcointalk forum exists. so i must say you are lucky you came to right place. These websites are not scams well at least 40% are not scam. idk which faucet you have joined but there is a long list of faucets on Bitcointalk forum.  Micro Earnings Its a section on Bitcointalk forum where legit platform with reviews are listed. i must tell you i am not promoting them i am just helping you to get a better idea of the forum. You should also see the Meta and help and beginner section too for better options to grow over less time period. For your better guide, i must say spending time on these faucet is no doubt profitable but if you are stepping into crypto then you should also know how things works in crypto. Well i assure you working of crypto is not very difficult to understand. You can learn the basics by watching some videos on YT or by reading article wrote here. Running blind will take you no where, while if you run with the light of knowledge you could reach to your aim more easily and quickly. Knowledge of crypto and blockchain will help you to understand the importance and impact that it could make on modern life's sectors like finance etc.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: This is definitely not the answer you're looking for, but faucets are a total waste of time if we're talking about earning money. There are lots of better ways of earning money out there — you just need to exert a bit of time and effort into learning a skill.

comments.author: Maus0728
comments.body: Freebitco.in[1] is the only faucet that I know of which still exists today and is considered reputable. However, the issue with using a faucet is that you need to constantly claim a very small amount of satoshis repeatedly for months before you can withdraw. And, sometimes the amount you've accumulated couldn't even cover the transaction fees, which can result in wasting your time and effort.[1] https://freebitco.in/signup/?op=s#

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: Quote from: SELL3R on March 05, 2023, 07:52:18 AMCan anyone recommend a better website for earning free crypto that doesn’t have a catch to it and doesn’t have any withdrawing restrictions etc? Faucets are a waste of time, as mk4 has said but the best one if you are willing to keep trying is freebitco.in, as Maus0728 has told you. Most likely scenario you will be wasting your time but if you are lucky you can land a $200 reward just playing free spins which is like winning the lottery but you get the tickets for free.

comments.author: crypticj
comments.body: Nah, everyone who offers you a "free crypto" probably wants to scam/ take advantage of you. There is nothing free or easy in this world. So if you want to make legit good money better go and learn about blockchain and smart contract deployment.

comments.author: Don Pedro Dinero
comments.body: Quote from: crypticj on March 05, 2023, 08:56:38 AMNah, everyone who offers you a "free crypto" probably wants to scam/ take advantage of you. Not necessarily. In the case of freebitco.in the free faucet is a way to attract people to their casino, where in the end they make a lot more money from people who gamble than they potentially lose from the few people who use the faucet to get a few satoshis and don't gamble.Giving things away for free or at a discount, although it may seem paradoxical at first glance, often serves to increase turnover.

comments.author: Bellarg
comments.body: Faucets are dead for 5-7 years already

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Quote from: crypticj on March 05, 2023, 08:56:38 AMNah, everyone who offers you a "free crypto" probably wants to scam/ take advantage of you. There is nothing free or easy in this world.Quite unrealistic for a person to give out money in exchange for money in the first place, ain't it? Most legitimate faucets(that are mostly dead already) aren't as evil as you think. They give you free satoshis in exchange for you viewing ads on their platform.

comments.author: posi
comments.body: As Maus0728 said, Freebitco.in is probably the only surviving and most reputable faucet today. 10 years ago, faucets could have been a great place to get free bitcoins, but now it's just a waste of our time. Today's free bitcoin earning methods don't work anymore, if you want to invest in bitcoin instead of wasting time on faucets or airdrops. I recommend you find an outside job, earn extra income and then invest in bitcoin. It's the fastest way to get bitcoins, getting free bitcoins is just a waste.

comments.author: Cryptoababe
comments.body: Most faucets advertise ads to earn and give you returns in Crypto whenever you complete some tasks. Maybe by clicking on ads or passing through some ads in one way or the other.And the worst thing is that most of these faucet will suddenly disappear or stop paying out.The best thing is to open an exchange account or participate in airdrops. For me, to get free cryoto, I do participate promotional airdrops on exchanges like MEXC Global, Kucoin and at times Binance. And I also do airdrops via Telegram channels ones in a while.

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: SELL3R on March 05, 2023, 07:52:18 AMIs this site legit or just a waste of time and a scam?I can only say that I received dozens of payouts from that faucet and that I never had any problems - as far as I'm concerned, one of the serious faucets that exist today.Quote from: Bellarg on March 05, 2023, 08:59:43 AMFaucets are dead for 5-7 years alreadyOf course they are, I just don't know how I personally earn the same monthly income from those same faucets as if I participated in some average sig campaign on the forum? Of course, it is about passive income because I have a large number of referrals.

comments.author: ethereumhunter
comments.body: I've never used faucetcrypto before so I don't recommend it. I advise you to try freebitco.in only if you want to play with the faucet because on that site, you only need to press the button once an hour and it's completely free and doesn't have many requirements. You can also invest your money into FUN tokens and earn more WoF. I don't think it's difficult to withdraw because on the site, you only need to collect 0.00030000 BTC with a transaction fee of 0.00000488 BTC for automatic and slow ones.

comments.author: Bananington
comments.body: Quote from: SELL3R on March 05, 2023, 07:52:18 AMPs: I’m new to crypto and would like to own my very first crypto….The best way to want to get bitcoins is to buy bitcoins in any amount that you can afford. Buying bitcoin is not restricted to only people who have a lot of money, and there is not a fixed amount that you must buy. You can buy in any amount that you can afford and then from there discipline yourself to adopting a strategy to buy more. Plenty people are accumulating the amount of bitcoins that they have by engaging in the DCA method where you dedicate yourself to buying an amount regularly. That strategy will work better for you a newbie than depending on any website to give you free bitcoins.

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: SELL3R on March 05, 2023, 07:52:18 AMCan anyone recommend a better website for earning free crypto that doesn’t have a catch to it and doesn’t have any withdrawing restrictions etc? Looking for free crypto online is almost the same as searching for free money. Remember, legitimate websites that offer cryptocurrency rewards typically require some form of effort or investment, such as completing surveys, watching ads, or referring new users. There is usually no such thing as completely free cryptocurrency with no strings attached. Regarding bitcoin faucets, that's a thing of the past, and it is difficult to find a legit one that pays a significant amount. It's more probable that investing your time in other activities would be more profitable in the long run.

comments.author: SELL3R
comments.body: I think I’m just going to give up on Faucets since doing research it just not worth it since you have to spend a really long time doing tasks and only getting about 0.50c.Hope I can find other things out there to make some crypto. Thanks everyone I appreciate the many replies.
